docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 21. -- Bolivia and Paraguay signed today a pact providing for the release of all war prisoners and the renewal of diplomatic relations. The pact reestablished peace, which was broken by the outbreak of the Chaco war on June 19,...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 21. -- Bolivia and Paraguay signed today a pact providing for the release of all war prisoners and the renewal of diplomatic relations. The pact reestablished peace, which was broken by the outbreak of the Chaco war on June 19, 1932.
docs.abstract: pact signed by Bolivia and Paraguay; provisions

headline.main: CHACO PACT FREES PRISONERS OF WAR; Agreement Also Provides for Diplomatic Relations Between Bolivia and Paraguay. LONG DISPUTE IS ENDED Buenos Aires Peace Conference Puts Off Territorial Issues Till After Elections.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Jan. 22. -- King Carol of Rumania, whom the late King George refused to receive at Buckingham Palace, is one of four Kings who have already announced that they are coming to England for the funeral at Windsor Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Jan. 22. -- King Carol of Rumania, whom the late King George refused to receive at Buckingham Palace, is one of four Kings who have already announced that they are coming to England for the funeral at Windsor Tuesday.
docs.abstract: Will attend funeral of George V

headline.main: Royal Figures of Europe Will Journey to England for Rites; CAROL, FROWNED ON, TO ATTEND FUNERAL Rumanian Monarch, Whom King George Declined to Receive, Will Be There. 3 OTHER KINGS ARE GOING N.H. Davis Named to Represent U.S. Composition of Other Delegations Announced.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Jan. 23.--Flatly defying Uruguay to prove her charges that the Soviet Legation abused its diplomatic privileges by helping Brazilian revolutionists with checks, Foreign Commissar Litvinoff of Soviet Russia vainly offered today to authorize...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Jan. 23.--Flatly defying Uruguay to prove her charges that the Soviet Legation abused its diplomatic privileges by helping Brazilian revolutionists with checks, Foreign Commissar Litvinoff of Soviet Russia vainly offered today to authorize Uruguayan banks to divulge all his legation's financial transactions.
docs.abstract: Challenges Uruguayan diplomatic break with USSR, League of Nations hearing

headline.main: SOVIET CHALLENGES URUGUAYAN ACTION; Litvinoff Demands at Geneva That Montevideo Reveal the Alleged Bank Accounts. HIS REQUEST IS REFUSED Commissar Alludes to Italy, Japan and Germany as Aggressive Nations. SOVIET DEMANDS URUGUAY'S DATA

byline.original: By CLARENCE K. STREIT.Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Jan. 24. -- The League of Nations Council session adjourned tonight after getting the Danzig Nazi Government to give in on every issue, after deciding to leave the Soviet-Uruguayan dispute to public opinion and after making provisional...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Jan. 24. -- The League of Nations Council session adjourned tonight after getting the Danzig Nazi Government to give in on every issue, after deciding to leave the Soviet-Uruguayan dispute to public opinion and after making provisional refugee arrangements on the lines that experts recently recommended.
docs.abstract: League Council pres to name High Comr

headline.main: DANZIG NAZIS YIELD TO LEAGUE COUNCIL; Accept Defeat on Every Point -- Soviet and Uruguay Agree to Drop Controversy. REFUGEE PARLEY CALED

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 25. -- The Iuyamtorg Corporation, Soviet trading agency in Montevideo, has begun definite liquidation preparatory to going out of business and leaving South America, it is announced in the Uruguayan capital.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 25. -- The Iuyamtorg Corporation, Soviet trading agency in Montevideo, has begun definite liquidation preparatory to going out of business and leaving South America, it is announced in the Uruguayan capital.
docs.abstract: Yuamtorg Corp begins liquidation; Brazil begins revolt inquiry

headline.main: SOVIET WITHDRAWS MONTEVIDEO FIRM; Moscow's Only Trade Company in South America Is Being Liquidated. IT MADE BIG PURCHASES Brazil Begins Revolt Inquiry -- Press Says Litvinoff Tried to Becloud Issue.

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE.Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Pierre Laval, Premier of France, has joined Sir Samuel Hoare, British co-author of the rejected Hoare-Laval plan for the pacification of Ethiopia, in temporary exile from public life. He resigned last Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pierre Laval, Premier of France, has joined Sir Samuel Hoare, British co-author of the rejected Hoare-Laval plan for the pacification of Ethiopia, in temporary exile from public life. He resigned last Wednesday.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 25. -- While in Geneva Maxim Litvinoff, Soviet Foreign Commissar, and Dr. Alberto Guani, Uruguayan League delegate, were defending their viewpoints, Brazil was swearing in a special committee, recently appointed by President...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Jan. 25. -- While in Geneva Maxim Litvinoff, Soviet Foreign Commissar, and Dr. Alberto Guani, Uruguayan League delegate, were defending their viewpoints, Brazil was swearing in a special committee, recently appointed by President Vargas, to investigate the November revolt and the extent to which Communists were involved.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: LEAGUE IS ASSAILED BY BRAZILIAN PRESS; Failure to Act in Dispute of Russia and Uruguay Is Held to Prove Big Powers' Dominance.
